application

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the game board instance and moves the player and enemy.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andy Kuo, George Stallard

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(java.lang.String filePath)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads in info from level file and set the important information.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the name of the level file you wanted to retrieve.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Indicates that the an error whereby the file is not found could occur.

      • touchEnemy

        public boolean touchEnemy(int x,
                          int y)
        Checks whether the player touches the enemy.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate that player about to step on.
        y - the y-coordinate that player about to step on.
        Returns:
        true if the position is an instance of an enemy.

      • move

        public int move(java.lang.String way)
        Moves the player and the enemy. Also plays sound when player steps on an enemy Checks whether the player is dead or not.
        Parameters:
        way - Where the player wants to move to.
        Returns:
        0 if nothing happens.

      • checkPlayerDead

        private boolean checkPlayerDead()
        Checks if the next position the enemy will move to is the player.
        Returns:
        true if the next step is player and therefore the player is dead.

      • playerDead

        private boolean playerDead()
        Checks if the player is about to move onto a tile with a enemy.
        Returns:
        true if player walks towards enemy.

      • straightMove

        Moves the straight line enemy.
        Parameters:
        x - current x-position of enemy.
        y - current y-position of enemy.
        i - the index of the enemy stored in the enemy arrays.
